marketNews.title: State Budget Suffers Deficit in 2M25 as Revenues Plummet
marketNews.content: The Ministry of Finance held a briefing regarding the realization of the 2025 State Budget on Thursday (13/3). This was the first State Budget briefing in 2025, after the Ministry of Finance did not hold a discussion for January 2025 last month. Minister of Finance, Sri Mulyani, stated that the briefing for the realization of the State Budget as of January 2025 was not held to ensure the presentation of comparable and accurate data, considering several factors that occurred at the beginning of this year. Here are some of our notes regarding the realization of the State Budget in 2M25: State Revenue Drops -20.8% YoY, Equivalent to 10.5% of Target. Deputy Minister of Finance, Anggito Abimanyu, stated that gross tax revenue during 2M25 slowed down (-20.8% YoY) due to declines in commodity prices, including coal (-11.8% YoY), Brent oil (-5.2% YoY), and nickel (-5.9% YoY). The decline in tax revenue was also caused by tax administration factors, such as the implementation of the Average Effective Tariff (Tarif Efektif Rata-rata or TER) policy for PPh 21 and the relaxation of domestic VAT payments up to 10 days (until March 10, 2025) for tax reporting. State Expenditure Drops -7% YoY, Equivalent to 9.6% of Target. Deputy Minister of Finance, Suahasil Nazara, stated that state expenditure decreased by -7% YoY during 2M25 due to the high-base effect from high spending during late 2023 to early 2024 caused by El Nino. In addition, Suahasil also explained that President Prabowo Subianto's instruction regarding efficiency in ministry/agency spending up to 306.7 trillion rupiah aims to fund priority government programs, increase fiscal space for productive spending, and fund the vision and mission programs of new regional heads. Deficit Arrives Earlier, Reaching 0.13% of GDP. With this progress, the State Budget has recorded a deficit of 31.2 trillion rupiah or 0.13% of GDP during 2M25, marking an earlier deficit compared to the previous year (vs. February 2024: surplus of 0.11% of GDP). This is the first time the State Budget has recorded a deficit in the first two months of the running year since 2021, according to a Bloomberg report. Budget Financing Reaches 35.7% of Target. Sri Mulyani also conveyed that there was a significant issuance early in the year, resulting in budget financing reaching 220.1 trillion rupiah (vs. 2025 State Budget target: 616.2 trillion rupiah). Nevertheless, this progress is similar to the realization as of February 2024, which reached 35.4% of the 2024 State Budget target. When closing the press conference, Sri Mulyani opened the possibility that the State Budget realization briefing could be skipped in certain months due to internal considerations related to data. Besides issues related to the State Budget, Bloomberg reported that there are rumors President Prabowo is preparing a cabinet reshuffle, which might involve Sri Mulyani. Spokesperson at the Presidential Communication Office, Phillips J. Vermonte, declined to comment on the issue, but emphasized that President Prabowo has the prerogative right to conduct a reshuffle. Sri Mulyani herself declined to comment to several national media outlets regarding this issue on Wednesday (12/3). Key Takeaway: The risk of the State Budget deficit widening is one of the investors' concerns, which also impacts the weak rupiah exchange rate. Since the beginning of the year, the rupiah exchange rate against the US dollar has weakened by -2% YTD to the level of 16,425, even though in the same period the DXY index fell -4.4% YTD to the level of 103.7. A weak exchange rate can narrow the space for Bank Indonesia to lower interest rates, even though the prospect of Fed interest rate cuts has increased recently in line with investor concerns about potential US recession due to the trade war. Meanwhile, the Bloomberg consensus projects Bank Indonesia will cut interest rates by another 50 bps until the end of 2025.

tickerNews.title: ISAT Rumored Again to Divest Fiber Assets Valued at US$1 Billion
tickerNews.content: Reuters reported that I Squared Capital and Macquarie are among the potential buyers of Indosat's fiber optic assets worth 1 billion US dollars. Reuters sources stated that ISAT could sell up to 75% of its fiber business shares, with final bids due in April 2025. However, Reuters sources said that no final decision has been made in the transaction, and the share portion and timeline may change depending on market conditions. ISAT has not commented on this issue. The issue of ISAT's fiber business divestment has emerged at least since 2023. Previously, DealStreetAsia reported in September 2024 that Dayamitra Telekomunikasi (MTEL), Protelindo, and XL Axiata (EXCL) were reportedly interested in these assets.

tickerNews.title: GoTo Management Targets Adjusted EBITDA of IDR 1.4-1.6 Trillion in 2025
tickerNews.content: GoTo Gojek Tokopedia management targets adjusted EBITDA of around 1.4-1.6 trillion rupiah during 2025 (vs. 2024: 386 billion rupiah). Of this amount, the 'On-Demand Services (ODS)' segment is projected to contribute a minimum of 1.1 trillion rupiah, while the 'Fintech' segment contribution is a minimum of 350 billion rupiah.

tickerNews.title: CUAN subsidiary purchased Petrosea (PTRO) shares valuing approximately IDR 27 Billion
tickerNews.content: Petrindo Jaya Kreasi (CUAN) through its subsidiary, PT Kreasi Jasa Persada, bought ~8.3 million shares of Petrosea at an average price of 3,263 rupiah per share on March 10-11, 2025. The total transaction value reached ~27 billion rupiah. After this transaction, PT Kreasi Jasa Persada's ownership in PTRO increased from 42.394% to 42.476%.

tickerNews.title: BBTN States Acquisition Value for Bank Victoria Syariah is IDR 1.5-1.6 Trillion
tickerNews.content: Bank Tabungan Negara President Director, Nixon L.P. Napitupulu, stated that the acquisition value for Bank Victoria Syariah ranges from 1.5-1.6 trillion rupiah. In the transaction, BBTN will take over state securities (SBN) and loan equity belonging to PT Bank Victoria Syariah, but the company will not take over the credit and third-party funds (DPK) held by that bank pre-acquisition. PT Bank Victoria Syariah itself is an entity directly owned by approximately 80.2% by Victoria Investama (VICO) and approximately 19.8% by Bank Victoria International (BVIC). The acquisition is expected to be completed in May 2025, with the BBTN General Meeting of Shareholders (RUPS) planned to be held on March 14, 2025.

tickerNews.title: SMIL targets net profit around IDR 100-110 Billion in 2025, plans to increase 2024 dividend payout ratio to 40%
tickerNews.content: Head of Investor Relations Sarana Mitra Luas, Ridwan Syah, stated that the company targets a net profit of around 100-110 billion rupiah during 2025, with a revenue growth target of approximately +20-25% YoY. For context, SMIL projected a net profit during 2024 in the range of 80-90 billion rupiah. This performance growth target will be supported by market expansion both regionally and through customer acquisition, where Ridwan mentioned that the company has obtained commitment cooperation from one of the largest tobacco companies in Indonesia. Ridwan also explained that SMIL plans to increase the dividend payout ratio for the 2024 fiscal year from 20% to around 40%.

tickerNews.title: TINS targets tin production growth of +15% YoY in 2025, projects 2024 net profit reversal to IDR 1-1.1 Trillion
tickerNews.content: Timah Corporate Secretary, Rendi Kurniawan, stated that the company targets tin production to grow by +15% YoY during 2025 to a range of 21,000-23,000 tons. Rendi also mentioned that TINS's net profit during 2024 is expected to be around 1-1.1 trillion rupiah - reversing from a net loss of 450 billion rupiah during 2023 - although the financial statements for that period have not been audited. Previously, Rendi stated that TINS targeted a net profit of around 1-1.5 trillion rupiah during 2025 and confirmed it would distribute the 2024 fiscal year dividend with a payout ratio of around 30-35%.

tickerNews.title: TOBA recorded a net loss of US$6.4 Million in 4Q24, resulting in a US$28.5 Million net profit for 2024 (+260% YoY)
tickerNews.content: TBS Energi Utama recorded a net loss of 6.4 million US dollars in 4Q24 (vs. 3Q24: net profit 8.3 million US dollars, 4Q23: net profit 410 thousand US dollars). This result brought the net profit for 2024 to 28.5 million US dollars (+260% YoY). Although revenue in 4Q24 managed to grow +24% QoQ, the cost of goods sold surged +65% QoQ, causing the gross profit margin to drop to 5.9% in 4Q24 (vs. 3Q24: 28.3%). The growth in the cost of goods sold in 4Q24 was caused by increased coal purchases and transportation and crane costs, by +156% QoQ and +63% QoQ, respectively.

tickerNews.title: US CPI Inflation Moderated to 2.8% YoY in February 2025
tickerNews.content: US Consumer Price Index (CPI) inflation was recorded to slow down to 2.8% YoY in February 2025 (vs. Jan 2025: 3% inflation), below consensus expectations which predicted 2.9% YoY. On a monthly basis, US CPI inflation slowed to 0.2% MoM (vs. Jan 2025: 0.5% inflation MoM), lower than consensus expectations of 0.3% MoM. Meanwhile, core inflation slowed to 3.1% YoY and 0.2% MoM (vs. Jan 2025: 3.3% inflation YoY, 0.4% inflation MoM), both below consensus expectations which predicted 3.2% YoY and 0.3% MoM, marking the lowest annual core inflation since April 2021.

tickerNews.title: J.P. Morgan Economist Sees 40% Recession Chance in US for 2025, Increasing Risk if Tit-for-Tat Tariffs Implemented
tickerNews.content: J.P. Morgan Chief Economist, Bruce Kasman, stated on Wednesday (13/3) that there is approximately a 40% chance the US economy will experience a recession in 2025, up from the 30% level in early year forecasts. Kasman also mentioned that the risk of recession will increase, possibly up to 50% or more, if the reciprocal tariffs advocated by US President Donald Trump are actually implemented starting April 2025. Furthermore, Kasman said there is a risk of long-term damage to the US's position as an investment destination if the Trump cabinet undermines confidence in US governance.

tickerNews.title: Canada Announced Counter Tariffs on US Imports Valued at ~US$20.7 Billion Starting March 13
tickerNews.content: Canada announced on Wednesday (12/3) counter tariffs of 25% on US imports valued at approximately US$20.7 billion, which will take effect starting Thursday (13/3). These counter tariffs will target steel and aluminum, as well as other consumer goods such as electronic equipment, household appliances, and sports equipment. The implementation of these counter tariffs follows the US government's move to impose a 25% import tariff on steel and aluminum commodities starting Wednesday (12/3).

tickerNews.title: DHL Group CEO Says Global Trade Expected to Grow Despite US Tariff Policies
tickerNews.content: DHL Group CEO, Tobias Meyer, stated on Wednesday (12/3) that global trade is still expected to grow, although not too rapidly, as the world reacts to the tariff policies of US President Donald Trump. This projection is mainly based on the fact that 75% of global trade does not involve the US. According to the DHL Trade Atlas 2025 report prepared by DHL and New York University, global trade is projected to grow with a CAGR of +3.1% in 2024-2029, faster than the previous decade. The report projects India, Vietnam, Indonesia, and the Philippines will lead trade growth in 2024-2029.

tickerNews.title: IMJS Assumes IDR 500-600 Billion Proceeds from Rights Issue to Fund Subsidiary Capital Injection
tickerNews.content: Indomobil Multi Jasa (IMJS) stated in a clarification to the IDX that the company assumes proceeds of around 500-600 billion rupiah in drafting the rights issue plan for up to 3 billion new shares announced last week. This amount is equivalent to 32.5-39% of IMJS's total market cap as of Thursday (13/3) at the level of ~1.5 trillion rupiah. IMJS also mentioned that the company's controller, Indomobil Sukses Internasional (IMAS), will exercise all its rights, while the maximum dilution effect is 25.74%. Furthermore, IMJS explained that all proceeds from this corporate action will be used for capital injection into its subsidiaries. This plan will be discussed in the GMS on April 14, 2025.

tickerNews.title: DMAS Targets Marketing Sales of IDR 1.81 Trillion in 2025, Lower than 2024 Realization
tickerNews.content: Puradelta Lestari (DMAS) targets marketing sales of 1.81 trillion rupiah during 2025, unchanged from the 2024 marketing sales target and 3.2% lower than the 2024 marketing sales realization of 1.87 trillion rupiah. DMAS Director and Corporate Secretary, Tondy Suwanto, stated that this conservative target considers the national economic growth rate and the global geopolitical situation. Tondy also explained that in early 2025, there is still industrial land demand of around 90 ha dominated by the data center segment, in addition to other sectors such as FMCG, chemicals, and others.

tickerNews.title: Djoni, Shareholder of NINE, Increased Ownership to 5.1% After Purchasing ~10 Million Shares
tickerNews.content: Techno9 Indonesia (NINE) Shareholder, Djoni, bought approximately 10 million NINE shares at an average price of 254 rupiah per share on March 11, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 2.5 billion rupiah. After this transaction, Djoni's ownership in NINE increased from 4.63% to 5.1%.

tickerNews.title: Founder and CEO of Intiland Development (DILD), Hendro Santoso Gondokusumo, Passed Away in Singapore Today (March 13)
tickerNews.content: Founder and CEO of Intiland Development (DILD), Hendro Santoso Gondokusumo, passed away in Singapore today, Thursday (13/3).
